Tarot is an upcoming American supernatural horror film written and directed by Spenser Cohen and Anna Halberg (in their feature film directorial debut) and co-written by Nicholas Adams. It is based on a 1992 novel, Horrorscope, by Nicholas Adams. The film stars Harriet Slater, Adain Bradley, Avantika Vandanapu, Wolfgang Novogratz, Humberly González, Larsen Thompson, and Jacob Batalon.
Tarot is scheduled to be released in the United States by Sony Pictures Releasing on May 3, 2024.


Premise[edit]
The plot centers on a group of college friends who start dying in ways that are related to their fortunes after having their tarot cards read. Before their time runs out, they have to work together to uncover the mystery.[2]

Cast[edit]
Harriet Slater[3][4]
Jacob Batalon[5]
Avantika Vandanapu[6]
Adain Bradley[6]
Humberly González[7]
Olwen Fouéré[3]
Wolfgang Novogratz[3]
Larsen Thompson[3]
Production[edit]
Deadline Hollywood reported the production of Horrorscope in June 2022, with Jacob Batalon in the leading role.[6] The film was directed and written by Spenser Cohen and Ana Halberg, based on Nicholas Adams's 1992 novel of the same name.[2] Ground Control's Scott Glassgold produced through Alloy Entertainment, together with Leslie Morgenstein and Elysa Koplovitz Dutton. Halberg and Cohen served as executive producers.[6] Screen Gems also produced the film.[5][8] In January 2024, the film was renamed to Tarot.[9]

Release[edit]
Tarot was originally scheduled to be released on June 28, 2024,[10] before being moved up to May 10, 2024.[11] It was later moved up a week to May 3, 2024.[12]

^ @SonyPictures (January 30, 2024). "Whose face will you see when you take your last breath? @TarotMovie is coming exclusively to theaters this May. #TarotMovie" (Tweet) – via Twitter.

^ Grobar, Matt (May 16, 2023). "Sony Pushes 'Harold And The Purple Crayon' And 'They Listen' To 2024, Sets Dates For 'My Ex-Friend's Wedding,' 'Horrorscope' And 'Psycho-Pass: Providence'". Deadline. Archived from the original on May 17, 2023. Retrieved October 27, 2023.

^ Squires, Josh (December 7, 2023). "Sony's Horror Movie Horrorscope Moves Into May 2024 Release Date". Bloody Disgusting. Archived from the original on December 8, 2023. Retrieved December 7, 2023.
